Text.Value: That thing he summoned was illithid. Follow it below, and find him - before he has a chance to subdue the Nightsong again.
Face Ketheric with me.
Better you stay behind. I'll handle things from here.
The General will call that a 'tactical retreat', I'm sure. But you have him on the run.
Theory and supposition. None of which will helps us in the fight to come.
Join me, then.
But if you have room for one lone soldier - I would face Ketheric by your side.
Your have numbers enough already, I think. You'll want a small force, if you are to finish this quickly.
I can handle this - don't worry.
Ketheric awaits. What do you need from me?
I don't doubt it - but I'd come with you, if you'll have me.
I certainly do.
Lead and I follow, commander.
Good hunting.
But the sooner we reach Ketheric and rob his army of their reason to fight, the better.
Ketheric must die, and the Absolute with him. We will work out the details as they rear their ugly heads.
Don't you want to see how this ends?
As you wish.
You and your Harpers aren't coming?
Do you really think your soldiers can hold out against an entire army?
If our luck holds, they won't need to. If it doesn't, well - they are Harpers. Being outnumbered is part of the job.
Do you know what to expect when we find him?
My Harpers are stationed below. Should Ketheric's main force catch wind of our assault and move against us, they will hold the tower.
Better they stay here, and hold the tower should Ketheric's army catch wind of our assault.
Leave.
My Harpers and I will hold the tower while we can - and wait to hear when the deed is done.
Long enough, at least - for us to do what must be done.

Synopsis: After Ketheric has been forced to retreat to the Colony, Jaheira joins us on the tower rooftop and offers to officially join the party.
